# Draft:John Warner (conductor)

John Warner is a British orchestral and operatic conductor and music director. He is Music Director of Oxford Opera and of Southern Sinfonia, and the founder (2018) and Artistic Director of Orchestra for the Earth (OFE).  In May 2025 Marina Mahler presented Warner with the Mahler Award at the Concertgebouw’s Mahler Festival after his performance with the New European Ensemble in the “Mahler Beyond” series.
Career
Warner founded Orchestra for the Earth in 2018. The ensemble’s projects have received international media coverage for linking performance with environmental themes, including a concert at the Delabole Wind Farm to mark Earth Overshoot Day.
In 2023 Warner served as an artist in residence at the Beijing Music Festival, curating and conducting programmes that paired Mahler with twentieth- and twenty-first-century works, including Chinese premieres.  A documentary by Dutch filmmaker Frank Scheffer, Gustav Mahler – Singer for the Earth, features Warner’s projects in Europe and China.
Warner has been Music Director of Oxford Opera, where he has conducted productions including La traviata (2023) and Tosca (2025). Reviews noted the quality of orchestral playing under his direction.  A preview by Seen and Heard International outlined the production and Warner’s role as conductor.
In 2025 Warner was named Music Director of Southern Sinfonia, a professional chamber orchestra based in Somerset.  Earlier engagements include assisting at the 2023 Glyndebourne Festival for Dialogues des Carmélites.
Awards
* Mahler Award (2025), presented at the Mahler Festival, Het Concertgebouw.
Education
Warner studied music at the University of Oxford and, as a student, won the university’s conducting competition in 2015.
